SharedMem:
["Greg is a first year math student and is having a lot of trouble with his linear algebra exam.", 
"Very soon Greg will have to take an exam and he is desperate because he is afraid of not passing it.", 
"Luckily his friend Michael offered to tutored him on some of the basics."]
ScenarioPremise: After the exam Greg says his friend, “You’re a big help.”
Options:
["To ask if he passed the exam",
"To say he is sorry",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say he's happy to have been helpful"]
LcGoal: Greg wants to pass the linear algebra exam
LcContext: Greg isn't very good at linear algebra
LcSpecificMem: Greg passed the exam thanks to the help of Michael
LcExtras: Greg is talking with Michael after the exam
IlcGoal: Michael wants to know how Greg's exam went
IlcContext: Michael is very good at linear algebra
IlcSpecificMem: Michel thinks that Greg didn't pass the exam
IlcExtras: Michael his talking with Greg after his exam

SharedMem: ["Iris is walking alone in a dark alley.", "Her younger brother Jim is nearby and plans to play a prank on her.", "She doesn’t know he is there and is startled when he touches her."]
Options:
["To say he wanted to play a prank on her", 
"To say he's sorry if she got scared", 
"To wait for an answer", 
"To say he's glad she found it funny"]
LcGoal: Iris wants to feel safe walking in the alley
LcContext: Iris is startled by her brother’s prank
LcSpecificMem: Iris realizes it is a prank
LcExtras: Iris is surprised and turns around
IlcContext: Jim sneaks up on her in the dark
IlcSpecificMem: Jim is sorry because he thinks his sister was really scared
Illocutor_answer: To say he's sorry if she got scared

SharedMem:
["Pat asks his friend Greg to help by carrying a vase of water to the table.", 
"Greg isn’t very careful, slips, and nearly drops the vase.", 
"The vase breaks and spills water everywhere despite a last-minute attempt to save it."]
ScenarioPremise: After the vase breaks, Pat says to their friend, “Smart move.”
Options:
["To say that he was actually very agile", 
"To say he's sorry", 
"To wait for an answer", 
"To say that unfortunately it did not help to save the vase"]
LcGoal: Pat wants the vase to be safely brought to the table
LcContext: Pat’s friend nearly drops the vase
LcSpecificMem: Pat is surprised by Greg's agility in trying to retrieve the vase
IlcGoal: Greg wants to help but isn’t very careful
IlcContext: Greg slips and nearly drops the vase
IlcSpecificMem: Greg is very sorry for his carelessness and for breaking the vase
IlcExtras: Greg stands far from the table

SharedMem:
["Alex and Mark are moving and need help carrying heavy furniture.", 
"They call their friend Kyle, who says he'll be there soon."]
ScenarioPremise: As Kyle arrives, Alex says to him, “You're just in time.”
Options:
["To say he's happy to have arrived just in time",
 "To say he's sorry he was late",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To say he found traffic"]
LcContext: Alex and Mark are nearly done loading the van
LcSpecificMem: Alex knows that Kyle's help will be useful because another van with heavy furniture is arriving
IlcGoal: Kyle wants to help his friends move
IlcContext: Kyle took a long time to arrive
IlcSpecificMem: Kyle thinks he arrived when they had already finished unloading the furniture
Illocutor_answer: To say he's sorry he was late

SharedMem:

 "Mark passes the ball to Kyle, giving him a chance to score.",
 "Kyle misses the shot and fails to score a goal."]

"To say he's sorry for missing that",
"To wait for an answer",
 "To thank him for the compliment"]

LcContext: Mark watches as Kyle misses an opportunity to score
LcSpecificMem: Mark thinks Kyle made a good shot
LcExtras: Mark is focused on the outcome of the game

IlcContext: Kyle misses a shot after receiving a pass from Mark

IlcExtras: Kyle looks disappointed after missing the shot

SharedMem:
["Jim and Tom are doctoral students at New York University, working on a challenging project assigned by their supervisor.",
 "They’re struggling to keep up and are frequently changing the project to meet deadlines.",
 "In a meeting with their supervisor and other faculty, they explain yet another modification to the project."]
ScenarioPremise: During the meeting, the supervisor says, “They're really on top of things.”
Options:
["To say they are doing their best",
 "To say they are sorry and will try harder",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To thank him for recognizing their efforts"]
LcGoal: The supervisor wants the project completed efficiently
LcContext: The supervisor is aware of Jim and Tom’s ongoing struggles
LcSpecificMem: The supervisor is not concerned about the project delays
LcExtras: The supervisor is addressing Jim and Tom in a meeting
IlcGoal: Jim wants to finish the project successfully
IlcContext: Jim has been working with Tom on frequent changes
IlcSpecificMem: Jim thinks the supervisor wants to scold them
IlcExtras: Jim is trying to manage their workload
Illocutor_answer: To say they are sorry and will try harder

SharedMem:
["Sara and Brian have been a couple for years and share an apartment.",
 "Sara always wakes up early to go to work, while Brian sleeps in because he works from home.",
 "This morning, Sara didn’t hear the alarm and is rushing to avoid being late.",
 "While preparing breakfast, she accidentally spills a cup of tea, breaking it and spilling tea on the floor."]
ScenarioPremise: After the cup breaks and tea spills, Sara says, “That's just what I needed today!”
Options:
["To ask if she can work from home",
 "To say he is sorry for her bad day",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To say it is fortunate that she can work from home"]
LcGoal: Sara wants to get to work on time
LcContext: Sara is rushing after waking up late
LcSpecificMem: Sara is happy to be late because then she will work from home
LcExtras: Sara is frustrated by the tea spill
IlcContext: Brian woke up after the accident
IlcSpecificMem: Brian thinks Sara is upset about the delay
IlcExtras: Brian isn’t involved in the morning rush
Illocutor_answer: To say he is sorry for her bad day

SharedMem:
["Tim is a 14-year-old boy who wants to go out with his friends to eat ice cream.",
 "Tim decides to ignore the weather forecast and leaves without the umbrella."]
ScenarioPremise: After Tim returns home wet, he tells his mother it rained, and she replies, “Well, what a surprise.”
Options:
["To say he thought it would rain later",
"To say he should have taken the umbrella",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that the weather forecast was wrong"]
LcGoal: Tim's mother wants Tim to avoid getting wet
LcContext: Tim's mother suggested Tim to check the weather forecast
LcSpecificMem: Tim's mother is unaware of the weather forecast
LcExtras: Tim's mother is at home when Tim returns
IlcGoal: Tim wants to go out with friends
IlcSpecificMem: Tim knew about the weather forecast but decided to go out without an umbrella
IlcExtras: Tim is a bit embarrassed by the outcome
Illocutor_answer: To say he should have taken the umbrella
